prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Rayfa:
All members of the Khura'inist clergy have such marks upon them.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite. It reads: The priestess acting as Lady Kee'ra's representative must know her name and have seen her face. That name is Ihmsan. Speaking this name is unforgivable. Lock this knowledge deep in your heart, and devote yourself to prayer. [caption] There is an image of the goddess. She is doing a ritual dance, holding a bird-shaped dagger in her right hand. She is wearing a mask and a tiara.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. [caption] There are two upright stone slabs, straddling over a stream of water. There is a small table and some stools. Tools are scarttered. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The latest victim was Puhray Zeh'lot.
Person: Ema
Testimony 1
Testimony: He had been training under the high priest, and living at his house for the past two years.
Person: Ema
Testimony 2
Testimony: The high priest's widow Beh'leeb Inmee has identified the victim's body.
Person: Ema
Testimony 3
Testimony: He was an illegal immigrant, so we don't know his real name.
Person: Ema
Testimony 4
Testimony: He may have been mistaken for a rebel and killed due to his connection to the high priest.
Person: Ema

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 2, the May 9th Newspaper, reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities on the morning of the Purification Rite. Testimony 8, Maya's Statement, says that on the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum. If the weather was normal according to the newspaper, the water being stained red beforehand as per Maya's statement might contradict the reported weather conditions or usual environment expected.

However, the more clear-cut contradiction appears with Evidence 12, the Envelope, which was addressed to the high priest and had three unusual-looking holes punched into it, suggesting a secretive or suspicious nature. Testimony 9, Lady Kee'ra's Warning, says only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered the warning. If the envelope was delivered but the holes suggest it was tampered with or something secret, that might imply a contradiction regarding access.

The real contradiction is between Evidence 3, Tahrust's Autopsy Report, which states the cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon, and Testimony 17, Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report, which indicates the cause of death was a spinal cord injury from a stab to the upper back with a bladed weapon. These reports are about different victims but both involve death by stabbing and could be confused, but no direct contradiction.

Looking at testimony 3 and 1 from Ema: "He was an illegal immigrant, so we don't know his real name" (testimony 3) conflicts with testimony 1: "He had been training under the high priest, and living at his house for the past two years." It's contradictory that an illegal immigrant could have been openly training and living for two years in the high priest's home if his real identity is unknown.

Therefore, the pair of evidence and testimony with a clear contradiction is:

Evidence 2: May 9th Newspaper reports usual weather (no mention of blood in water or any suspicious event beforehand).

Testimony 8: Maya's Statement claims the water in the spring was already stained red at the start of the day.

These directly contradict the reported weather and situation in the newspaper.

Testimony 0

Person: Tahrust

Testimony 2

Person: Tahrust
Testimony 3

Person: Tahrust
Testimony 4
Testimony: After that, there was a loud noise, followed by haunting silence.
Person: Tahrust
Testimony 5
Testimony: I would describe the noise as a terrible crash. Poor Zeh'lot... It must have felt so heavy.
Person: Tahrust

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 8 (Maya's Statement) says that the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum. This implies there was blood in the spring before the events of the rite progressed.

Testimony 0 (by Tahrust) says that he was entertaining His Magistry and his family when the crime occurred, suggesting that the crime happened during a time when others were present and it was not yet known or noticed by them.

There is no direct contradiction here.

Looking closer, Evidence 7 (Inner Sanctum Photo) shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard. The broken wind guard suggests a disturbance, and the photo presumably is taken after the crime.

Testimony 2 (Tahrust) states: "When I listened to the tape later, I heard a man and a woman quarreling."

Testimony 3 (Tahrust): "It sounded like an altercation between Acolyte Zeh'lot and Acolyte Fey."

So Tahrust heard quarreling between Zeh'lot and Fey.

Now, Evidence 16 (Crime Photo of Zeh'lot): Zeh'lot was killed in the Plaza of Devotion.

Evidence 17 (Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report): Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed.

But the testimony says Zeh'lot was involved in a quarrel with Fey.

Considering the place and times, there is no direct contradiction here.

Looking for contradictions involving time or alibis.

Tahrust's Testimony suggests he was entertaining others during the crime, but Evidence 8 says Maya and Abbot Inmee were at the Inner Sanctum when the water was already stained.

Maya is a close associate of the defense, so it's plausible.

Is there a conflict with Testimony 1 (Beh'leeb was in the kitchen cooking the entire time) and any other evidence?

Evidence 8 (water stained red) possibly implies bloodshed before the crime was noticed by Tahrust or Beh'leeb.

Tahrust says in Testimony 1 that his wife was in the kitchen cooking the entire time, implying she could not have been outside where the blood staining occurred.

Consider the Bloodstained Letter (Evidence 5): A letter found at the Inner Sanctum with a giant bloodstain making it hard to read fully.

If the letter was stained with blood inside the sanctum, and Beh'leeb was cooking inside during the entire time (per Testimony 1), then the bloodstain could be her blood or elsewhere.

No clear contradiction.

Looking at the Letter and Tahrust's statements is not directly contradictory.

Alternatively, consider Evidence 9 (Lady Kee'ra's Warning), which states that only someone capable of entering the priest’s home could have delivered it, and Testimony 0 (Tahrust) says he was entertaining others when the crime occurred. This could be contradictory if Tahrust was not at home but the warning implied knowledge only an insider could have.

Still, perhaps not a direct contradiction.

Focusing instead on Evidence 8 (Maya's Statement) - The water was already stained red when Maya and Abbot Inmee arrived. This suggests the injury to the high priest occurred before everyone else knew.

But Testimony 0 says Tahrust was entertaining when the crime occurred, implying the crime happened in more public context.

This implies a contradiction about the timing of the crime.

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 8 and Testimony 0.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 8 (Maya's Statement) says that on the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum. This indicates the presence of blood before or at the time of their arrival.

Testimony 3 (Tahrust's statement) says that "She attacked and killed me with a strength far beyond any mortal woman," implying that the attacker was a living person, particularly a spirit medium who knows Lady Kee'ra's true name (Maya, per testimonies 0 and 1).

If the water was already stained with blood before Maya's arrival (Evidence 8), it implies the attack or killing had already happened before Maya and Abbot Inmee arrived. This contradicts Testimony 3 which suggests Maya (or the spirit she channeled) attacked and killed Tahrust.

Therefore, these two contradict each other or at least raise questions about the timing of the attack and who could be responsible.
